summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence focuses on scheduling meetings, discussing trial witness identification from JPMorgan, and requesting account ownership documents for a specific account (Q78859008).

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or advising a party in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating meetings and document requests with the prosecution.

persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York prosecuting the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with defense about scheduling, witness issues, and document requests.

persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced throughout the email subject lines (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial

events.description: Defense requests a trial appearance subpoena for a witness from JPMorgan.

keyFacts: Prosecutors and defense attorneys are coordinating to identify and subpoena a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase.
The prosecution is requesting account ownership documents for a specific financial account numbered Q78859008.
Jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial was underway in November 2021, complicating scheduling.
The correspondence shows ongoing pre-trial evidence gathering and witness preparation between the parties.
